intro: Hieracium murorum subsp. chloroleucum, commonly known as the yellow hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe. It features a low-growing rosette of basal leaves and produces yellow flowers in summer. The plant has a taproot system and is often found in disturbed soils, such as roadsides and waste areas. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs. It is part of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads.
